name: Hotel Grand Pacific

reviews.title: Fair Hotel
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 day stay in Victoria. The staff at this hotel was absolutley wonderful. Location was perfect, close to downtown and within walking distance to and from the Ferries. Our room had a relaxing deep soaking tub and a great view. My only complaint was that one of the bed's pillow shams and comforter did not smell clean. We didn't want to complain, so we just slept in the other queen bed. This was an expensive hotel and I felt that for the price, the rooms should have been more stylish. Victoria was a nice place to visit, but I will not return.

I stayed at the Grand Pacific Hotel based on reviews on various websites, but was sorely disappointed. When we arrived the room was not ready at 4:30pm and I was told that if I waited 30 minutes I would get a nice room with a view on an upper floor (8th floor). When I finally got our room 30 minutes later, it was not the room they promised. It was on the 6th floor and the only way you get a view was if you go out to the balcony and lean over. That was their idea of a harbour view room. Below is the description on their website:
reviews.title: Deceptive practices and alot of lying

reviews.text: "Deluxe room with one bed or two beds with views of the Inner or Outer Harbour from your private balcony. "
reviews.title: everything and more

reviews.text: After a great deal of complaining they finally agreed to give us an upgraded room on a lower floor with a view without charging the increase they originally stated they would have to charge us.
reviews.title: Could have been better
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: The one bedroom we finally got was nice, but beware because you might not get what you paid for. If you stay in the one bedroom, then the hotel would have been worth it. Otherwise it depends on what you think you are paying for.

This hotel is everything a full service hotel should be. Spa, dining, room service and beautiful waterfront rooms. The staff was top notch! From the counter staff, the cleaning people, the valet, spa staff and restaurant staff. Not a detail is missed in my opinion. Being literally next door to the parliment buildings was great! You can walk almost everywhere. The museum is a MUST SEE! Do take a carriage ride through Beacon Hill Park. Do go whale watching, you'lll see them! (we used Great Pacific Adventures and it was an awesome choice!) Do try Luciano's for fabulous italian food. Do take a water taxi to Spinnakers for the BBQ chicken pizza w/blue cheese and have a couple of pints. The point is all of these exciting and delightful activities are available, walking distance FROM the Hotel Grand Pacific. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel on the waterfront

reviews.text: We just returned from a stay in Victoria at the Grand Pacific. It is a beautiful modern hotel, ideally located on the inner harbour and with stunning views of the harbour, the legislature building, and the mountains. It is also within easy walking distance of both excellent shopping and walking trails! The staff are friendly and helpful. My room (though I didn't spend much time in it - there was so much to explore) was very large, with a king-size bed, a sofa and easy chair - and a little balcony to watch the world go by or just let in the fresh air. Despite its central location, the hotel is very quiet. The restaurant is casual and the food excellent.
reviews.title: Definitely Grand!

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel recently and we received friendly efficient service from all hotel staff. Our King room was comfortable, clean and fairly well appointed. As previously mentioned by others, the location is very good and within walking distance to all the tourist sights of the Victoria waterfront and downtown areas. The restaurant serves great breakfasts whether having buffet or choosing off the menu. The fine dining spot also serves good cuisine. Would consider this hotel if returning to Victoria in the future.
reviews.title: Friendly, Efficient Service

reviews.text: We have no complaints. Enjoyed the location...staff was awesome, including the valet who had to tolerate us getting our SUV in and out of valet two sometimes three times each day.
reviews.title: Staff was great

reviews.text: Pool was great even for our young children, room service excellent. Everything met to our expectations and we felt the room pricing was right on par with the luxury.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Close to Victoria Clipper terminal

reviews.text: My friend and I spent a couple of nights here and we were very pleased. The location is perfect. If arriving from the US, the harbor is across the street. We flew into Vancouver and took the ferry from Schwartz Bay, so a car was a necessity for us. We didn't need it around town, however. The hotel had free parking-the only one we stayed at that did. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. It had a nice bathroom with an extra sink outside the bathroom door. The staff was gracious and helpful at all times. I would definitly stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Great location! If you are coming on a Ferry, book this place and skip a rental car. Two minute walk from the US Ferries. This hotel is also really close to all Inner Harbour activities. The interior is clean and modern. Pick this over the Empress because it is for your Grandma and her friends (old and stuff). Pick this over the Delta because of its more awkward location. This is your winner for a great trip to Victoria, BC
reviews.title: Great Time!

reviews.text: Although check-time was advertised as 3 pm, the hotel staff were more than happy to accommodate us when we arrived at 12:30pm. Our room was indeed comfortable & well-appointed, and the view from the balcony was absolutely stunning. Not only did we have an unparallelled view of Victoria's inner harbour, but we had a partial view of the Parliament buildings & the nighttime illumination. Credit must go to the hotel gardener, who turned out to be VERY popular with the ducks in the hotel duck pond: they'd follow the gardener everywhere (most likely because he had a full bucket of bird feed on his gardening wagon!). The hotel staff was friendly and efficient, and the pool & hot tub were exactly what I needed!
reviews.title: Highly recommended
Awesome hotel, loved Victoria
reviews.text: We travelled from FL, USA and couldn't have been more thrilled!! Staff "jumped" around to wait on us...room clean and well appointed...breakfast at hotel was GREAT...Spa had many ammenities and we got massages and pedicures and all the workers seemed very happy to work there. Great location as we walked every where...definetely would recommend this hotel and the city of Victoria!!! Stay 3 nights and 4days..could have used an entire week.

My husband and I celebrated his August 1 birthday by booking a harborview room at the Hotel Grand Pacific in beautiful, cool Victoria. It's not inexpensive but we felt we received value for our money.
reviews.title: Spoil yourself at the Hotel Grand Pacific

reviews.text: We've stayed here twice and eaten in the resturant one evening and one morning. It is a grand hotel when it comes to price and the rooms are nice but the views not so grand(unless you book a suite). The staff forgot to furnish the extras that were suppose to come with our special 'weekend' and we had to ask for them, only to find the some of the extras had expired(specials in the cafe etc). The pool,gym,steam room etc are also open to the public and Victoria residents so can be crowded, although they are very nice .The food is good but not exceptional.All together there are better places to stay in Victoria.
reviews.title: Nice but Grand?

reviews.text: We spent one week on Vancouver Island with our first and last night in Victoria. It had been 25 years since we visited Victoria. It has grown and become much more touristy but it is still one of the prettiest harbors in the world & has retained most of it's old world charm. Our trip was planned at the last minute and we are so glad we decided to go to Vancouver Island in the off season. The hotel is a half block from the US ferry docks and for some reason I totally over packed so I was glad to save the walking for later. We also enjoyed watching the ferries come and go from our balcony. For our first night we splurged on a suite which overlooked the harbor and the provincial capital. Every room at this hotel has a balcony. The hotel itself is clean, charming, quiet, comfortable, with lots of great amenities and a good restaraunt as mentioned by others in it's reviews.
reviews.title: Luxurious & convenient haven

reviews.text: However it is the staff that makes this place stand out. From my first phone call for reservations to the doorman who bid us good bye everybody was fantastic. The front desk clerk worked with me to get me that special room for both visits. Our second room overlooked the capital, the city and the mountains. Honestly I do not think this hotel has a bad room. Our trip into the Island was totally unplanned and unscripted. The entire staff helped us plan our trip around the city as well as what to do on the island. This is a place which is honestly geared toward creating a memorable wonderful experience. In the off season it was also a bargain as we got great rooms, meals and travel agents all rolled into one. Pamper yourself stay here at least once in your life.
reviews.title: Grand, but not great
Fantastic
reviews.text: Don't misunderstand me; this hotel is really grand, the location is almost perfect, and the rooms and facilites very nice. There is nothing about which to complain. We just didn't feel the same warmth and welcome that we found elsewhere in Canada, where "niceness" seems to be a national characteristic. The staff was helpful when asked, but not outgoing.
The entire atmosphere seemed a little too pretentious for this charming small city. It has the feeling of an over-priced big city hotel; maybe that's one reason it also seemed overpriced.
reviews.title: Hotel Grand is just that...GRAND..

description: What you want. Where you want it. Luxuriate your senses — breathe invigorating sea air from your private balcony, pamper your dining pleasure by indulging in cuisine prepared with fresh local ingredients in The Mark and The Pacific restaurants, Courtyard Cafe, Pacific Lounge, and 24-hour room service; renew your energy in our health and leisure facilities; and experience genuine intuitive service delivered by our professional staff. We are here to make your stay memorable and personalized. Customize your mini-bar, pamper your pet, and partake in yoga and fitness classes in our Victoria Athletic Club. Facing the Inner Harbour and adjacent to the British Columbia Legislature, the Hotel Grand Pacific, Recent Conde Nast Travelers Choice award recipient, is 2 blocks from Victoria's downtown restaurant and shopping scene, 2 blocks from the Victoria Conference Centre and 5 blocks from Fisherman’s Wharf, a working harbour surrounded by an array of food kiosks, unique shops and ecotour adventures. The Victoria of today is urban, outdoorsy, culinary and hip. Experience Victoria today. Victoria was included in the Top 10 Family Vacations in Canada in the TripAdvisor 2011 Travelers’ Choice Awards.
